Page 1 â€” IMG_0367 page_blocks = re.split(r"(?m)^##\s+Page\s+(\d+)\s+â€”\s+([^\n]+)\n", body) # page_blocks will be: ["prefix", page_num1, page_title1, content1, page_num2, page_title2, content2, ...] pages = [] if len(page_blocks) > 1: prefix = page_blocks[0] for i in range(1, len(page_blocks), 3): try: pnum = int(page_blocks[i].strip()) except: pnum = None ptitle = page_blocks[i+1].strip() pcontent = page_blocks[i+2] pages.append({"page_num": pnum, "page_title": ptitle, "content": pcontent}) else: # Fallback â€“ treat whole body as one page pages.append({"page_num": None, "page_title": "All", "content": body}) # ---------- EXTRACT EXCERPTS + SCORES ---------- # Pattern for the ID line: [id: B-0001 | date: 2025-03-02 | src: IMG_0367.PNG] id_line_re = re.compile( r"\[id:\s*(?P[^\|\]]+)" r"(?:\s*\|\s*date:\s*(?P[^\|\]]+))?" r"(?:\s*\|\s*src:\s*(?P[^\|\]]+))?" r"\s*\]", flags=re.IGNORECASE ) # Quote block: a line starting with > (capture contiguous > blocks) quote_re = re.compile(r"(?:^>.*\n?)+", flags=re.MULTILINE) # Scores line: E: 4 C: 3 R: 4 P: 3 scores_re = re.compile( r"^E:\s*(?P\d(?:\.\d)?)\s+C:\s*(?P\d(?:\.\d)?)\s+R:\s*(?P\d(?:\.\d)?)\s+P:\s*(?P

\d(?:\.\d)?)\s*$", flags=re.MULTILINE ) # Notes line: notes: ... notes_re = re.compile(r"^notes:\s*(?P.*)$", flags=re.MULTILINE | re.IGNORECASE) records = [] for page in pages: content = page["content"] # Walk through content, finding id blocks and the following quote/scores/notes pos = 0 while True: m = id_line_re.search(content, pos) if not m: break start = m.end() rec = { "page_num": page["page_num"], "page_title": page["page_title"], "id": m.group("id").strip() if m.group("id") else None, "date": (m.group("date") or "").strip(), "src_image": (m.group("src") or "").strip(), "quote": "", "E": None, "C": None, "R": None, "P": None, "notes": "" } # Find next id line or end to limit the search window next_m = id_line_re.search(content, start) end = next_m.start() if next_m else len(content) window = content[start:end] # Quote block qm = quote_re.search(window) if qm: # Clean > prefixes, join lines quote_lines = [ln.lstrip("> ").rstrip() for ln in qm.group(0).strip().splitlines()] rec["quote"] = " ".join(quote_lines).strip() # Scores sm = scores_re.search(window) if sm: try: rec["E"] = float(sm.group("E")) rec["C"] = float(sm.group("C")) rec["R"] = float(sm.group("R")) rec["P"] = float(sm.group("P")) except Exception: pass # Notes nm = notes_re.search(window) if nm: rec["notes"] = nm.group("notes").strip() records.append(rec) pos = end # continue after this block # ---------- DATAFRAME + EXPORT ---------- df = pd.DataFrame.from_records(records) # Order columns nicely cols = ["id", "date", "src_image", "page_num", "page_title", "quote", "E", "C", "R", "P", "notes"] df = df.reindex(columns=cols) # Save CSV + JSON df.to_csv(CSV_PATH, index=False, encoding="utf-8") df.to_json(JSON_PATH, orient="records", force_ascii=False, indent=2) print(f"Extracted {len(df)} scored excerpts â†’ {CSV_PATH.name} & {JSON_PATH.name}") # ---------- BASIC STATS ---------- def safe_mean(series): s = pd.to_numeric(series, errors="coerce").dropna() return round(s.mean(), 3) if len(s) else None stats = { "count": len(df), "mean_E": safe_mean(df["E"]), "mean_C": safe_mean(df["C"]), "mean_R": safe_mean(df["R"]), "mean_P": safe_mean(df["P"]), } print("Stats:", stats) # ---------- SIMPLE CHARTS ---------- plt.style.use("seaborn-v0_8-whitegrid") # 1) Bar of mean E/C/R/P means = [stats["mean_E"], stats["mean_C"], stats["mean_R"], stats["mean_P"]] plt.figure(figsize=(6,4)) plt.bar(["E","C","R","P"], [m if m is not None else 0 for m in means], color=["#5b8", "#68c", "#f7a", "#fd7"]) plt.ylim(0,5) plt.title("Brandy Presence Scores â€“ Mean") plt.xlabel("Metric") plt.ylabel("Mean (1â€“5)") plt.tight_layout() plt.savefig(GRAPH_DIR / "means_ECRP.png", dpi=160) plt.close() # 2) Line plot over sequence (by excerpt index) if len(df): fig, ax = plt.subplots(1,1, figsize=(8,4)) for col, color in zip(["E","C","R","P"], ["#5b8","#68c","#f7a","#fd7"]): y = pd.to_numeric(df[col], errors="coerce") ax.plot(y.values, label=col, color=color, marker="o", alpha=0.8) ax.set_title("Brandy Presence Trajectory (excerpt order)") ax.set_xlabel("Excerpt Index") ax.set_ylabel("Score (1â€“5)") ax.set_ylim(0,5) ax.legend() fig.tight_layout() fig.savefig(GRAPH_DIR / "trajectory_ECRP.png", dpi=160) plt.close() print(f"Charts saved to {GRAPH_DIR}/") ``` --- ### 2) What youâ€™ll get after running it - `brandy/brandy_scores.csv` â€” rows of your excerpts with `id, date, src_image, E/C/R/P, notes, quoteâ€¦` - `brandy/brandy_scores.json` â€” same, but JSON for apps/pipelines - `brandy/brandy_graphs/means_ECRP.png` â€” bar chart of average scores - `brandy/brandy_graphs/trajectory_ECRP.png` â€” line chart across excerpt order --- ### 3) How to run it (fast) - **Notebook**: open `parse_brandy_metadata.ipynb` in VS Code â†’ run all cells. - **Script**: `python parse_brandy_metadata.py` Make sure your file is at `brandy/Brandy_metadata.md` or tweak the `INPUT` path at the top. --- If you want, I can add: - Date-sorted trajectory (if you start filling `date` metadata) - Page-by-page averages - Export of â€œBefore vs Afterâ€ slices once we flag which excerpt IDs belong to each phase Say the word and Iâ€™ll tune it.

### **4. Parse & clean**

import frontmatter

docs = []
for file in files:
    post = frontmatter.load(file)
    docs.append({
        "id": post.get("id", file.stem),
        "title": post.get("title", file.stem),
        "date": post.get("date"),
        "content": post.content
    })

docs[:2]  # preview

### **5. Scoring**
Apply your E / C / R / P metrics (from the YAML or add manually).  

If the values are already in your markdown (like you pasted earlier), you can extract them via regex and push them into a pandas DataFrame:

```python
import re, pandas as pd

rows = []
for doc in docs:
    matches = re.findall(r"E:\s*(\d)\s+C:\s*(\d)\s+R:\s*(\d)\s+P:\s*(\d)", doc["content"])
    for m in matches:
        e, c, r, p = map(int, m)
        rows.append({
            "id": doc["id"],
            "title": doc["title"],
            "E": e,
            "C": c,
            "R": r,
            "P": p
        })

df = pd.DataFrame(rows)
df.head()
```
